name: Celestial
description: A beautiful couatl twines through the clouds. This card suggests the involvement of celestial beings and service to the divine.

person.upright: A devout person who looks for miracles and the presence of the divine in all parts of life.
person.reverse: Someone who carries a grudge over a real or perceived injury caused by a god or Celestial.

creatureTrap.upright: A Celestial or other creature that has connections to the gods, or a trap that deals radiant damage.
creatureTrap.reverse: A fallen Celestial or similar creature that has lost its connection to the divine.

place.upright: A location on the upper planes, or a place suffused with their influence.
place.reverse: A place intended to ward off Celestials and influence from the Upper Planes.

treasure.upright: An art object depicting angels or other Celestials, treasure from the Upper Planes, or magic items made by Celestials.
treasure.reverse: A treasure depicting a Celestial's fall, or a magic item useful against Celestials.

situation.upright: Communication between the Upper Planes and the Material Planeâ€”perhaps in dreams or visions, or with Celestials as intermediaries.
situation.reverse: A situation involving Celestials' unwelcome interference in mortal affairs.
